;;2023-10-17T17:18:03Z;
;
;;显示混乱世界中大脑过度刺激的概念图。
;

;被诊断为注意力集中的人研究表明，缺陷性多动障碍 (ADHD) 是成年人在以后的生活中患痴呆症的风险更大。

;

;虽然专家警告说，这项研究并未确定这种明显的联系是否是因果关系，但他们表示它强调需要进一步探索可能的联系，并检查 ADHD 药物是否可以减轻任何潜在的痴呆风险。

;

;结果来自对超过 100,000 人的医疗记录的研究，发现那些被诊断为 ADHD 的人成年人在以后的生活中被诊断出患有痴呆症的风险几乎是成年人的三倍。

;

;这项工作背后的团队表示，成人多动症所涉及的过程可能会降低大脑补偿过程影响的能力这可能在以后的生活中发生，包括神经退行性变或大脑血流。

;

;“这与成人多动症会增加痴呆风险的主要结果一致，并且有轻微的反向因果关系证据，”斯蒂芬·莱文博士说，海法大学该研究的第一作者。

;

;;研究人员在《Jama Network Open》杂志上撰文;，报告称他们研究了以色列非营利性健康维护组织 (HMO) Meuhedet Healthcare Services 的电子健康记录。已被诊断为注意力缺陷多动症或痴呆症的人被排除在研究之外。

;

;研究小组查看了 109,218 人的记录，该研究于 2003 年 1 月开始，这些人的平均年龄为 57.7 岁，并跟踪他们的记录，直到以死亡、离开 HMO、被诊断患有痴呆症或研究于 2020 年 2 月结束为准。

;

;结果显示，在研究期间，有 730 人被诊断为成人 ADHD，96 ( 13%），其中还被诊断患有痴呆症。相比之下，在没有接受成人多动症诊断的人中，有 7,630 人 (7%) 被诊断为痴呆症。

;

;在考虑了年龄、性别、社会经济地位、吸烟和各种健康状况等因素后，研究小组发现，在研究期间被诊断为成人多动症的人，被诊断为痴呆症的风险是正常人的 2.77 倍。

;

;结果还表明，多动症药物改变了这一情况。

;

;“研究小组写道，在服用精神兴奋药物（用于治疗多动症）的人中，多动症和痴呆风险之间没有明显的关联，并补充说这一发现需要进一步研究。

;

;然而，莱文指出，该团队无法确定结果是否适用于儿童多动症，并且该研究无法证明因果关系。

;

;未参与这项工作的南安普顿大学 Roxana O Carare 教授也强调了后一点，但建议未来的工作可以探索多动症中所见的大脑神经递质水平的紊乱是否与患痴呆症的较高风险有关。

;

;然而，诺丁汉大学的克里斯·霍利斯教授表示，可能有很多因素让事情变得更加混乱。他说：“那些寻求并接受多动症诊断的成年人也更有可能接受包括痴呆症在内的其他认知/神经精神疾病评估。”他补充说，如果痴呆症诊断能够通过脑成像独立证实，也将令人放心。

;

;“至关重要的是，多动症患者不应惊慌，”他说。 “需要更多的研究来证实这种联系，如果得到证实，一个重要的问题将是多动症治疗是否可以减轻这种潜在风险。”英国多动症慈善机构首席执行官亨利·谢尔福德（Henry Shelford）表示，一个关键结论从这项工作中可以看出，需要更多地了解 ADHD 及其副作用。

;

;“目前英国的 ADHD 正在努力获得适当的认可，更不用说重要的深入研究了，”他说。

;;鲁珀特·默多克
;

;鲁珀特·默多克的新闻集团应该寻求 70 亿美元（57 亿英镑）的重组一位激进投资者表示，该公司将关闭其在线房地产业务，以帮助提高其市值。

;

;一直在增持新闻集团股份的对冲基金 Starboard Value 表示，该公司的估值为 126 亿美元。该公司“没有意义”，管理层应该考虑拆分该业务。

;

;默多克上任不到一个月后就发出了电话;宣布从他建立的媒体帝国退休;。

;

;“如果新闻集团Starboard 首席执行官杰夫·史密斯 (Jeff Smith) 周二表示：“通过免税分拆来分离数字房地产资产……股东将看到公司股价大幅升值。”

;

;Starboard 估计剥离高利润的房地产资产（其中包括美国 Realtor.com 的所有者 Move Inc 和澳大利亚 REA 集团的权益）可为新闻集团带来 70 亿美元的意外之财。

;

;“我们相信他们会想要……分离数字房地产资产，以便能够突出这个美丽的业务的价值，”史密斯说，他说他已经与新闻集团讨论了该计划。

;

;;一月份鲁珀特报废之后默多克计划重组新闻集团和福克斯;（这两家公司在十年前因电话窃听丑闻而分拆），该公司曾短暂考虑过以 30 亿美元的价格将 Move Inc 出售给 CoStar Group 的可能性。

;

;“我们始终与投资者保持积极和参与的对话，并致力于推动股东价值，”新闻集团发言人表示。“我们仍然专注于执行我们的战略计划，这帮助我们创造了盈利记录过去三年。我们为我们快速的数字化转型以及长期增长和价值创造的光明前景感到自豪。”

;

;由鲁珀特 (Rupert) 管理的默多克家族信托公司控制着新闻集团 40% 的投票权，福克斯，使激进分子主导的变革成为一个非常困难的主张。

;

;11 月，Irenic Capital Management 表示，其对新闻集团的估值可能高达 230 亿美元，而《华尔街日报》出版商的估值则高达 10 美元bn 本身。

;

;然而，;新闻集团表现不佳的部分;将其当前市值拖至 126 亿美元。

;

;“这是一项伟大的业务，一项伟大的资产，史密斯说。

;

;他指出，新闻集团的新闻部门（包括《澳大利亚人报》和《纽约邮报》）的市盈率是其竞争对手《纽约时报》的四倍，后者的市盈率是《纽约时报》的四倍。交易价格为 15 倍。

;

;他补充说，房地产资产的交易价格为市盈率的 8 倍。

;

;拉克兰·默多克 (Lachlan Murdoch)，鲁珀特的长子，上个月接管了福克斯和新闻集团的运营，二十年前，公司对澳大利亚非常成功的 REA 业务进行了第一笔投资。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 01:52:02 +0800 Britney Spears: I had abortion while dating Justin Timberlakehttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/17/britney-spears-i-had-abortion-while-dating-justin-timberlake-memoir-woman-in-me
;;2023-10-17T16:55:22Z;
;
;;'我感觉像我自己的影子'…布兰妮·斯皮尔斯。
;

;第一个摘录自布兰妮·斯皮尔斯备受期待的回忆录《我体内的女人》已经出版，记录了她据称在不寻常的; ; ;

;斯皮尔斯的父亲杰米·斯皮尔斯(Jamie Spears)没有对这些摘录发表评论，但此前曾为监管安排进行过辩护，该安排的限制包括减少对孩子的监护权，以及斯皮尔斯只能领取津贴，而不能动用自己的钱。 “如果没有这种监管，布兰妮现在会在哪里？ ……我不知道她是否还能活着，”他在 2022 年 12 月说道。“为了保护她，也为了保护孩子们，监管是一个很好的工具。如果没有它，我认为她不可能找回孩子们。”

;

;2021 年，斯皮尔斯在法庭听证会上提出了一系列有关监管的令人震惊的主张，最终导致她被释放。那年11月的安排——包括她被迫采取节育措施并违背她的意愿服药。杰米·斯皮尔斯 (Jamie Spears) 在监管安排最终解散之前被暂停。

;

;在她的回忆录中，斯皮尔斯重复了法庭听证会中的一些指控，以及她在网上和后来发布的 2022 年 8 月语音备忘录删除了其中包括她父亲批评她体重的内容。她写道：“对于孩子来说，感觉自己永远不够好是一种令人心碎的状态。作为一个女孩，他向我灌输了这一信息，即使在我取得了如此多的成就之后，他仍然继续对我这样做。”

;

;她补充道：“我变得更像是一个实体，而不是一个实体。舞台上的一个人。我一直在我的骨头和血液中感受到音乐；他们从我身上偷走了这一点……我不应该承受家人对我所做的一切……这对我作为一名艺术家的创造力来说是毁灭性的。”

;

;斯皮尔斯说，她剃光头时发生的一个臭名昭著的事件就是一种反应自从她在十几岁的时候第一次登上排行榜以来，她所面临的审视。 “从我十几岁起，我就被上下打量过，人们告诉我他们对我身体的看法，”她写道。 “剃光头和表现出来是我反击的方式。但在监管之下，我明白那些日子已经结束了。”

;

;其他摘录让人回想起她童年时进入娱乐业的经历、她在 2001 年 MTV VMA 上的蛇披表演，以及她的表演。在电影《十字路口》中短暂的演艺生涯，该片最近在电影院重新上映。 “这段经历对我来说并不容易，”她谈到拍摄时说道。 “我想我开始了方法表演——只是我不知道如何突破我的角色……那几乎是我演艺生涯的开始和结束，我松了一口气。”监管结束后，斯皮尔斯重新开始录制歌曲，与埃尔顿·约翰 (Elton John) 合作录制了歌曲《Hold Me Closer》，并与 will.i.am 合作录制了《Mind Your Business》。她还与交往多年的男友 Sam Asghari 结婚，但两人在 14 个月后离婚。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 01:22:01 +0800 Seaweed was common food in Europe for thousands of years, researchers findhttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/17/seaweed-was-common-food-in-europe-for-thousands-of-years-researchers-find
;;2023-10-17T15:00:14Z;
;
;;红藻，Palmaria palmata，正在采集
;

;它可能被认为是西方一种不寻常的成分烹饪，出现在精美的食谱或当地美食中。但事实证明，几千年来海藻一直是欧洲人的常见食品。

;

;研究人员在从西班牙到立陶宛的多个地点发现了人类牙齿上食用海藻的迹象，时间跨度从公元前 6400 年左右到公元前 6400 年。这一发现令人惊讶，因为传统上认为新石器时代农业的兴起导致了水生资源的废弃。到 18 世纪，海藻被认为是饥荒食物。

;
;

;;相关：;;研究表明，梅诺卡岛的青铜时代人们服用了致幻药物;

;
;

;“这个想法事实上，欧洲根本没有出现过作为食物的东西，”该书的合著者、格拉斯哥大学史前考古学教授凯伦·哈迪 (Karen Hardy) 说。

;

;该研究背后的团队研究表明，虽然之前在考古遗址发现过海藻的证据，但尚不清楚它的用途，建议包括燃料和肥料。但这项新研究提供的证据表明，欧洲许多地方都食用海藻。

;

;“这些生物标记物来自牙结石内部。所以这是明确的。他们不可能没有咀嚼过它。”Hardy 说。

;

;Hardy 和同事在《自然通讯》杂志上撰文，报告了他们如何分析来自 28 个国家的 74 个人遗骸中的牙结石或牙垢样本。欧洲各地的考古遗址，从西班牙南部到苏格兰北部，年代可追溯至公元前 6400 年左右至公元 12 世纪。

;

;总共，来自其中 33 个人的 37 个样本被发现含有生物标志物，使团队能够探索这些生物标志物他们吃了什么，其中 26 个样本含有泄露化学物质，表明他们食用了海藻和池塘藻等食物。他们补充说，一个样本表明人们食用了海羽衣甘蓝，普林尼指出这种植物是水手治疗坏血病的药物。

;

;在某些情况下，研究小组甚至可以识别所吃海藻的颜色：例如，奥克尼群岛伊比斯特的新石器时代中晚期（公元前 3200-2800 年）遗址似乎有人食用红海藻。

;

;研究小组表示，证据表明，虽然如今的欧洲很少食用此类食物，直到最近，它们还是人们饮食中的习惯部分。

;

;目前还不清楚海藻作为一种食物有多重要，但研究人员表示，它可以定期采集，就像蘑菇和贝类一样。今天仍然聚集在一起补充其他食物来源。然而，它逐渐从菜单上消失，成为饥荒食品和动物饲料。

;

;Hardy 表示，她希望这项研究能够改变人们对海藻消费的看法，并鼓励人们尝试它，并补充说，这不仅是健康、美味，但丰富、本地和可再生资源。

;

;“如果人们真正相互联系并思考，如果我们以前吃过它，我们可以再次开始吃它，那将是一件美妙的事情，”她说。

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 00:22:01 +0800 US man wrongfully imprisoned for 16 years shot and killed by policehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/17/georgia-leonard-cure-killed-police
;;2023-10-17T13:11:58Z;
;

;

;唐纳德·图斯克呼吁波兰总统允许迅速组建一个新政府，因为该国正在等待反对派力量联盟能够多快上台。

;

;周日的 ;议会选举;让过去八年统治波兰的民粹主义法律与正义党 (PiS) 获得了周二宣布的最终计票结果显示，法律与公正党获得了 35.4% 的选票，而由前总理图斯克和欧洲议会议员领导的公民联盟则获得了 35.4% 的选票。理事会主席，得票率30.7%。中右翼的第三条道路获得 14.4% 的支持，左翼 Lewica 获得 8.6% 的支持，这三个派别应该能够组成一个联盟，在 460 个席位的议会中占据多数席位。

;

;图斯克在周日晚上投票结束后几分钟内就宣布获胜，并于周二呼吁总统安杰伊·杜达继续允许联盟组建新政府的进程。

;

;“我我向总统发出热情的呼吁，人们正在等待第一个决定，因此我们要求总统做出积极而迅速的决定，”图斯克在一份声明中说。

;

;“获胜的民主党派都在保持联系，并准备随时接管该国政府的责任。”他补充道。

;
;

;;相关：;;波兰公布最终选举数字，结果表明反对党可能组建联盟 - Europe live< /a>;

;
;

;随着结果正式确定，杜达的作用是表明他倾向于哪个政党应该获得第一个组建联盟的机会。传统表明他将转向法律与公正党，作为最大的政党，但所有其他政党都表示他们不会与法律与公正党合作，这意味着现任政府没有途径建立联盟。

;

;即使是法律与公正党的人物，也有早些时候暗示他们计划尝试寻找一个联盟，现在看来已经承认失败了。 “邪恶暂时在波兰盛行，”法律与公正党高级官员马雷克·苏斯基 (Marek Suski) 告诉公共广播公司 TVP。 “法律与公正党很可能会转变为真正民主的反对派。”

;

;杜达办公室的 Małgorzata Paprocka 周二在声明中表示，情况“很复杂，需要总统考虑和分析”，并补充说杜达“确实不排除任何选择”。

;

;反对派联盟涵盖了波兰政治领域的广泛领域，但第三条道路联盟领导人西蒙·霍洛尼亚 (Szymon Hołownia) 表示，他没有预见到组建联盟会出现问题政府

;

;“我们会达成协议，因为我们知道历史已经发生在我们眼前。我预计组建政府及其计划不会出现任何重大问题。”他说。

;

;这一结果促使进步的波兰人庆祝法律与公正党统治的结束，该统治有 ;侵蚀法治;，减少堕胎权利以及针对少数群体和非欧洲移民的仇恨宣传。

;

;然而，人们仍然对未来几天和几周可能出现的法律与正义党的伎俩感到挥之不去。谨慎还源于这样的认识：在 2025 年之前，在一位与法律与正义党结盟的总统在任，且众多国家机构都挤满了法律与正义党的支持者的情况下，进行治理并不容易。

;
;

;;相关：< /span>;;《卫报》对波兰大选的看法：创纪录的投票率带来了里程碑式的结果 |社论;

;
;

;尽管如此，在投票前的一系列民意调查显示这场激烈的选举可能会导致政治僵局之后，明显的胜利让许多人感到高兴。 In the first-past-the-post ballot for the upper house of parliament, the three opposition groups cooperated to field single candidates against PiS in each district, and took 66 out of 100 seats.

;

;The victory is all the more remarkable given that the electoral playing field was hardly level. A preliminary monitoring ;report; from the Organisation for Cooperation and Security in Europe released on Monday found that PiS “enjoyed clear advantage through its undue influence over the use of state resources and the public media”.

;

;The record turnout, at 74.3%, was 13% higher than for the parliamentary election four years ago and appears to have been a factor in the opposition's victory. A particularly high voting rate among young people translated into more support for various anti-PiS parties.

;

;In the capital, Warsaw, turnout was an extraordinary 84.9%. “You have shown the enormous power of civil society. I am proud! Thank you!” Rafał Trzaskowski, the Civic Coalition mayor of Warsaw, ;wrote; on X, formerly Twitter.

;

;Another factor in the result was the decision not to unite opposition forces and run as a single anti-PiS list. In the end, giving people who wanted to vote against PiS but not for Tusk different options proved a wise strategy. While Lewica will be a little disappointed with its 8.6%, the 14.4% for Third Way, coming on the heels of a very strong performance in the only televised debate by its leader Holownia appears to have maximised the anti-PiS vote.

;

;The choice of democratic opposition parties also probably contributed to the dismal showing by Confederation, the far-right, anti-system party that had been polling well into double digits over the summer but in the end got just 7.2%

;

;Still, the breadth of the proposed new coalition may cause issues once PiS is out of office. Already on Tuesday, another Third Way leader, Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, said he would not guarantee to support liberalising the law to allow for abortions up to 12 weeks of pregnancy, one of Tusk's campaign promises. “No ideological issues can be part of any coalition agreement,” said Kosiniak-Kamysz.

;;Greta Thunberg between two Met police officers
;

;Greta Thunberg was arrested after joining hundreds of protesters who gathered at a five-star hotel in London on Tuesday morning to denounce a meeting branded “the Oscars of oil”.

;

;Footage showed the Swedish climate activist being bundled into the back of a van by police after taking part in protests blocking the entrances of the InterContinental on Park Lane, the venue for the Energy Intelligence Forum (EIF), which brings together fossil fuel executives and government ministers.

;

;Critics have called the event the “oily money conference”, in a nod to its previous name, the Oil & Money conference.

;

;Addressing journalists before joining the protest, Thunberg said: “Behind these closed doors at the oil and money conference, spineless politicians are making deals and compromises with lobbyists from destructive industries, the fossil fuel industry.

;

;“People all over the world are suffering and dying from the consequences of the climate crisis caused by these industries who we allow to meet with our politicians and have privileged access to.

;

;“The elites of the oil and money conference, they have no intention of transition. Their plan is to continue this destructive search for profits. That is why we have to take direct action to stop this and to kick oil money out of politics. We have no other option but to put our bodies outside this conference and to physically disrupt [it].”

; ;

;Dozens of protesters blocked Hamilton Place at each end with banners and pink umbrellas with eyes painted on them, shouting “oily money out” and “cancel the conference”, while others lit yellow and pink smoke flares.

;

;The hotel was cordoned off with fencing, and police escorted delegates through the crowd of chanting activists. A text message sent to delegates by the EIF organisers, obtained by the Guardian, warned them not to try to enter the hotel without help from the police, adding: “For your own safety do not attempt to cross the protest line.”

;

;A statement uploaded to social media by the Metropolitan police said there had been “interventions by officers to enable members of the public safe access in and out of the venue”. Six people were arrested for obstructing the highway, and a further 14 for breaching conditions on the protest imposed under section 14 of the Public Order Act.

;

;The EIF was due to hear from the chief executives of Aramco, Repsol, Shell, TotalEnergies and the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation, among others.

;

;The agenda included panels discussing questions such as “how far will renewable power go?”, “will net zero remain the standard?” and “how best to navigate climate, supply security and shareholder returns”. The event will culminate in an award ceremony with prizes for the “energy executive of the year” and the “energy leaders for tomorrow”.

;

;Fossil Free London, a climate campaign group, organised the protests. Robin Wells, its director, described the conference as an event “at which bigwigs are schmoozing politicians, including our elected representatives”.

;

;She said: “It's been going on for years and we think it shouldn't any more, because these events are just a constant opportunity for the oil industry to lobby our politicians and ensure they are able to continue to corrupt our political processes.”

;

;Wells said the conference had been due to hear from Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber, the chief executive of the Abu Dhabi national oil company and president of Cop28, which is due to take place in November. However, Al Jaber did not appear in the most updated roster, Wells said.

;

;As the protest was under way, Greenpeace activists appeared on a balcony near the roof of the hotel dressed in climbing gear and began abseiling down the front. After securing a rolled-up banner, they began descending the facade, revealing the message Make Big Oil Pay.

;

;However, strong winds meant they were unable to attach the bottom of the banner, with the abseilers blown across the front of the building, trying to keep a grip on the ropes it was attached to as it was caught by strong gusts.

;

;The mission was then stopped and the banner pulled back to the top of the hotel.

;

;The forum's organiser, Energy Intelligence, has been approached for comment.

;

;Malaysia's education ministry has pulled out of the Frankfurt book fair, citing the organisation's pro-Israel stance in the ongoing war between Hamas and Israel.

;

;In a statement published on Monday, the Malaysian ministry said that it “will not compromise with Israel's violence in Palestine, which clearly violates international laws and human rights”. This came after an awards ceremony celebrating Palestinian author Adania Shibli that was due to be held at the world's largest book fair ;was called off;.

;

;Over the weekend, book fair director Juergen Boos published a ;statement; detailing plans “to give Israeli and Jewish voices additional time on our stages” in the wake of “Hamas's barbaric terror war” and expressed “complete solidarity on the side of Israel”. In a statement shared with the Guardian on Tuesday, Boos said that “millions of innocent people in Israel and in Palestine are affected by this horrible war” and that “our sympathy goes out to all of them”.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Palestinian voices 'shut down' at Frankfurt Book Fair, say authors;

;
;

;The Malaysian ministry said that the decision to withdraw from the festival, which is scheduled to run between 18 and 22 October, is “in line with the government's stand to be in solidarity and offer full support for Palestine”. Malaysia, which has a Muslim-majority population, is a vocal supporter of Palestinian rights. On Monday, prime minister Anwar Ibrahim said that western officials have repeatedly asked Malaysia to condemn militant group Hamas in meetings but that his government does not agree with their “pressuring attitude”.

;

;The Indonesian Publishers Association (Ikapi) also condemned the fair's stance on Monday. “Siding with Israel while forgetting the suffering of the Palestinian people is like reading only one book to feel like you understand the whole world”, association chair Arys Hilman Nugraha said. Ikapi has “cancelled participation in the 2023 Frankfurt book fair, failed to attend the opening ceremony, and cancelled several events,” continued the statement.

;

;The Arab Publishers' Association, Emirates Publishers Association and Sharjah Book Authority also withdrew from the fair. “We are sad to see that some exhibitors from the Arab region withdrew their participation in this year's fair,” Boos ;said on Monday;.

;

;“The Frankfurt book fair stands for the peaceful encounter of people from all over the world. Since its very beginnings, the book fair has always been about humanity and its focus has always been on peaceful and democratic discourse,” he told the Guardian. “Freedom of expression is the backbone of our publishing industry. This is in the DNA of the Frankfurt book fair and what the fair stands for. We cannot comment on the decisions of individual exhibitors, but our platform is always open to authors, publishers, translators and literature fans from all over the world. Of course, the Frankfurt book fair is a platform for both Israeli and Palestinian voices.”

;

;Palestinian-born novelist Shibli was due to receive the 2023 LiBeraturpreis, an annual prize given to women writers from the global south. However, on Friday, LitProm – the association that administers the prize, and of which Boos is president – said it would postpone the ceremony “due to the war started by Hamas, under which millions of people in Israel and Palestine are suffering”. Though the association characterised the decision as a joint one, Shibli's literary agency told the Guardian that it was made without the author's consent.

;

;More than 1,000 writers and publishers have ;signed an open letter; condemning LitProm's decision, and on Monday PEN America urged the association to reconsider the move. Literary organisations “should affirm their commitment to free expression and pluralism even amid conflict”, said PEN's chief program officer Clarisse Rosaz Shariyf. Last Tuesday, PEN America said in a ;statement; that it “deplores the premeditated and vicious attack launched against Israeli civilians”.
